- Player 2: *Her claws had begun to dig into the sides of the tough wall to make her way to the roof, but she stopped upon hearing the words that came from the masked man's mouth. Agreement? They had no agreement. And what did Player 3 mean by 'interest'? Surely he could not hold such power over her. And she hardly remembered owing him TWO life debts. Another claw into the wall. It did not matter. Another foot up. There was no debt... Gods, what is she doing? She cannot walk away from this. As if compelled by another force, she steps back down to the balcony and peers over its edge down at the imposing shadow. Her voice was faltering, frustrated, and clearly offended.* "One does not remember owing such a grave debt twice over to you, cryptic one! Nor does one share the blood of a Darkling, least of all when compared with your darker visage! Away! Away with your deception!" *Darkling. He must be losing his mind along with his strength. Darkling... Though she did feel as though her body were changing much more quickly. But age worked differently here, did it not? Still, Tree was young. Spry. Though she is unsure how many moons she holds here, as the Feywilds did not offer such an easy way to track one's days. But... why did she feel so much.. older?*
- Player 2: *She peers at the man. Curious what he means. Discretely, she tries to prepare to connect to the masked man's psyche.*

This vault is just a little tougher to crack than that. ||Silly cat. I've got a proposition for you and you don't even know it. Well, alright. If that's how it'll be. I know how to catch cats. The trick is to make them come to you||* "Alright Sister. I get it. You know what. We'll just leave it as an IOU. Hopefully we'll get around to it before you whither away. From the looks of it, I've got you paced on that though. Maybe we'll bat the yarn around before it runs out" *I turn and hand in pockets, begin to make my way down the street. I've never known a cat to pass on such a tasty morsel. Curiosity kills and all that* *Unexpectedly, her connection with the mysterious one's mind was severed before she had an attempt to read into it. It was as if a fortress guarded his inner workings. It frustrated her, but made her more curious. Expecting him to delve into his meaning here and there, she listens to his next words with a devilish glint in her eyes. But then he simply babbles more riddles and turns to walk away. From her! He gave chase and then gives up so easily? Why? What did he mean 'wither away'? What did he know that she did not? Why couldn't she hear his thoughts? What did his face look like? Rrghhhh, this was unbearable. It was terrible to not know, and even worse when the answers were so close. Quickly, she steps up on the balcony and jumps down, being careful to slow her fall to avoid an embarrassing tumble.*
